required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of High Frequency Electrical Currents in Healthy Subjects.
clinical_study.official_title: Application of High Frequency Electrical Currents: Effects on Mechanical Threshold, Tactile Threshold and Evoked Potentials in Healthy Subjects.

collaborator.agency: Hospital Nacional de Parapléjicos de Toledo

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the transcutaneous application of unmodulated high frequency alternating currents could produce a quickly conduction block of peripheral nerve.

detailed_description.textblock:
In the last years several animal experimental studies have evidenced that high frequency unmodulated currents about 5 KHz can cause a peripheral nerve block. However electric currents with these high frequencies that are usually used for the treatment of pain in humans are interrupted or modulated (i.e. interferential currents).
It has show that the diameter of the nerve it is related with the frequency to produce the conduction block. For this reason we decided to applied 30KHz to observe the effects on pain in patients with whiplash and to compare versus sham stimulation.
Only one study has applied 5KHz on experimental pain and they have demonstrated changes in somatosensory thresholds.

primary_outcome.description: The pressure pain threshold will be measured by a pressure algometer and will be expressed in Newton
The tactile threshold will be measured with Von Frey filaments and will be expressed in millinewton
The muscle strength will be measured with a dynamometer and will be expressed in Newton
Evoked Potentials latencies will be measured and will be expressed in ms.

primary_outcome.measure: Mechanical Pain Threshold after treatment at 30 min
primary_outcome.description: The pressure pain threshold will be measured by a pressure algometer and will be expressed in Newton

primary_outcome.measure: Tactile Threshold after treatment at 30 min
primary_outcome.description: The tactile threshold will be measured with Von Frey filaments and will be expressed in millinewton

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle Strength after treatment at 30 min
primary_outcome.description: The muscle strength will be measured with a dynamometer and will be expressed in Newton

primary_outcome.measure: Evoked Potentials after treatment at 30 min
primary_outcome.description: Evoked Potentials latencies will be measured and will be expressed in ms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Mechanical Pain Threshold
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline at 0 min, immediately after treatment at 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: The pressure pain threshold will be measured by a pressure algometer and will be expressed in Newton

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline at 0 min, immediately after treatment at 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: The tactile threshold will be measured with Von Frey filaments and will be expressed in millinewton

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Muscle strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline at 0 min, immediately after treatment at 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: The muscle strength will be measured with a dynamometer and will be expressed in Newton

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Evoked Potentials
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline at 0 min, immediately after treatment at 30 min
secondary_outcome.description: Evoked Potentials latencies will be measured and will be expressed in ms.

arm_group.description: Transcutaneous application of high frequency electrical current over the arm for a 30 minutes session. The intensity of the current will increase until participants report a "strong but comfortable" sensation, just below motor threshold.

Electrodes are placed over the arm for a 30 minutes in the same manner as experimental group but will be applied a sham electrical stimulation increasing the current intensity of an unconnected channel.

intervention.description: high-Frequency electrical stimulation over superficial radial nerve through the electrotherapy device Myomed 932. (Enraf-Nonius, Delft, Netherlands)
Sham transcutaneous electrical stimulation over superficial radial nerve through the electrotherapy device Myomed 932. (Enraf-Nonius, Delft, Netherlands)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neuromuscular disease.
- Epilepsy.
- Trauma, surgery or pain affecting the upper limb, shoulder girdle or cervical area.
- Osteosynthesis material in the upper limb.
- Diabetes.
- Cancer.
- Cardiovascular disease.
- Pacemaker or other implanted electrical device.
- Take any drug (NSAIDs, corticosteroids, antidepressants, analgesics, antiepileptics, ...) during the study and in the previous 7 days.
- Presence of tattoos or other external agent introduced into the treatment or assessment area.
- Pregnancy.
